title: Medea
creator: Euripides
source: Librivox recording of a public-domain text
description: LibriVox recording of Medea by Euripides, translated by Gilbert Murray. Performed by a full cast. Euripides' tragedy focuses on the disintegration of the relationship between Jason, the hero who captured the Golden Fleece, and Medea, the sorceress who returned with him to Corinth and had two sons with him. As the play opens, Jason plans to marry the daughter of King Creon, and the lovesick Medea plots how to take her revenge. (Summary by Elizabeth Klett) For more free audio books, or to become a volunteer reader, please visit LibriVox.org. M4B format available
subject: librivox; audio; medea; euripides; tragedy; greek drama
